snippet: An emergency call reported that a boat carrying 21 people had sunk off Sandy Hook, N.J., but the Coast Guard said it had found no evidence of a catastrophe.
abstract: Authorities are investigating whether a June 11 emergency call reporting that a boat carrying 21 people had sunk in the Atlantic Ocean near Sandy Hook, NJ, may have been a possible hoax; first responders arrived at the scene to find no evidence of an accident.

byline.original: By JAMES BARRON and MICHAEL SCHWIRTZ
byline.contributor: Karen DeMasters and William K. Rashbaum contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: An emergency call reported that a boat carrying 21 people had sunk off Sandy Hook, N.J., but the Coast Guard said it had found no evidence of a catastrophe.

headline.seo: Investigation of Possible Hoax After Report of Yacht Explosion Off New Jersey
headline.main: Investigation of Possible Hoax After a Report of a Yacht Explosion Off New Jersey
headline.print_headline: Investigation of Possible Hoax After a Report of a Yacht Explosion Off New Jersey
